name: Cabal
summary: Large, rhinoceros-like humanoids from the planet of Torobatl. Their politics and society are similar to that of Ancient Rome.

name: Caitian
summary: Feline humanoid

name: Caleban
summary: invisible telepathic beings who are actually the minds of stars

name: Callineans
summary: Humanoid

name: Calvin
summary: Cephalopod-like

name: Conductoid
summary: Black-skinned aliens from planet Teslavorr, Conductoids are cycloptic humanoids with plugs on their fingers, prehensile tail, and antenna on their heads. They have the ability to absorb energy and redirect it as electrical energy.

name: Cascan
summary: Hailing from planet Cascareau in the Andromeda Galaxy, these aliens are very similar to Orishans, being armored humanoids able to manipulate water.

name: Cardassian
summary: Reptilian Humanoid

name: Carrionites
summary: Humanoid

name: Cat
summary: Felis Sapiens. Evolved over the course of three million years in deep space, from a domesticated housecat.

name: Catbug
summary: A combination part cat and part ladybug, Catbug simultaneously exists in two dimensions; reality and the See-Through Zone.

name: Cathar
summary: Cat-like humanoid

name: Catkind
summary: Feline Humanoid.

name: Cat People
summary: Feline humanoid.

name: Cat People
summary: Feline humanoid

name: Celestialsapien
summary: Horned humanoids with a body similar to that of a starry night sky from the Forge of Creation, they can warp space, time and reality. However, they are limited by their psyche: their minds are divided into separate personalities that need to agree in order to do even simple tasks, causing them to remain motionless for long periods of time.

name: Centauri
summary: Humanoid

name: Centrans
summary: Feline humanoids

name: Cerebrocrustacean
summary: Crab-like aliens from Encephalonus IV with massive heads due to super-sized brains. They are extremely intelligent (their IQ is at one nonillion), though not as smart as Galvans, and can use their enhanced intelligence to perfectly calculate the trajectory of objects, operate complicated machinery, and come up with strategies for combat on the fly, and also generate and manipulate electricity into electric blasts and force fields.

name: Ceti eel
source: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan
summary: bug-like brain parasites from Ceti Alpha V

name: Chaos
source: Independence War, aka I-War, and Independence War 2: Edge of Chaos

name: Charrids
summary: Humanoid

name: Chasch
source: Jack Vance's Planet of Adventure Series
summary: Big headed humanoids divided in subspecies.

name: Chatilian
summary: Humanoid

name: Cheela
summary: inhabitants of neutron star

name: Chenjesu
summary: Crystalline life-form

name: Cherubs
summary: Cherubs are characterized by their green exoskeleton.

name: Chimera
summary: Reptilian Hybrids between virus and host

name: Chimera Sui Generis
summary: Green-skinned cephalopodic humanoids from the planet Murray (later renamed Vilgaxia after their leader, galactic warlord Vilgax), who have the ability to turn into monstrous squid-like beings when submerged in water.

name: Chiss
summary: Blue-skinned red-eyed humanoids

name: Chronovore
summary: Universe devourers

name: Chozo
summary: Bird-like species.  Extremely technologically advanced and spread out across the galaxy.

name: Chronian
summary: Physically identical to humans. They have vast Time manipulation powers and able to create Energy beams. However, using their time powers weakens them over time, causing them to age faster.

name: Cocytans
summary: Furry, bird-like beings trapped in "Spacetime Six", a parallel universe.

name: Coeurl
source: The Voyage of the Space Beagle by A. E. van Vogt
summary: Similar to a big cat; prehensile tentacles sprouting from shoulders.  Feeds on potassium and/or organic phosphorus.

name: Colatas
summary: Humanoid

name: Combine
summary: an alien empire; note: many of the "Combine" seen in the game are actually humans that have been assimilated or collaborate as brutal police troopers.

name: Coneheads
summary: Humanoid with conical heads

name: Control Brains
summary: The Control Brains assign the Irken race with roles and are the unspoken leaders of the Irken Empire.

name: Coreeshi
summary: Humanoid

name: Coridanite
summary: Humanoid

name: Corvallen
summary: Reptilian Humanoid

name: Covenant
summary: Collective of alien species who are allied with each other, Composed of Grunts, Brutes, Elites, Hunters, Jackals, and Prophets. Religious Hierarchy with intent to destroy the Human Race.

name: Crystals
summary: Hi-tech aliens that has control over red crystals with unlimited powers, which are used to power up their weapons and equipment.

name: Crescendolls
summary: An alien band, inspired by the Daft Punk song of the same name.

name: Crites
summary: carnivorous hairballs

name: Cryons
summary: A crystalline humanoid race from planet Telos, they cannot survive temperatures above the freezing point, boiling and steaming in said temperatures.

name: Cybermen
summary: Marauding cybernetic life-forms. Originally an alien race driven to conversion by catastrophic climate change, more recently reimagined as assimilated humans.

name: Cybertronians
summary: Large robots from planet Cybertron able to change their shape at will into other mechanical constructs, most commonly varying types of vehicles like planes and trucks. Known more commonly as Transformers.

name: Cylons
summary: Sentient robots. Remnants of a civilization of reptilian aliens (also known as Cylons) in the original series, but created by humans in the remake series.  Both mechanical and biological flesh-and-blood versions co-exist, with the biological versions in charge.
